text.0: that we may win us wealth and power we poets verily call on thee.
text.1: in war men call on thee indra the heros lord in the steeds racecourse call on thee.
text.2: as such o wonderful whose hand holds thunder praised as mighty caster of the stone.
text.3: pour on us boldly indra kine and chariotsteeds ever to be the conquerors strength.
text.4: we call upon that indra who most active ever slays the foe.
text.5: lord of the brave most manly with a thousand powers help thou and prosper us in fight.
text.6: rcisama thou forcest men as with a bull with anger in the furious fray.
text.7: be thou our helper in the mighty battle fought for sunlight water and for life.
text.8: o indra bring us name and fame enriching mightiest excellent.
text.9: wherewith o wondrous god fairvisored thunderarmed thou hast filled full this earth and heaven.
text.10: we call on thee o king mighty amid the gods ruler of men to succour us.
text.11: all that is weak in us excellent god make firm make our foes easy to subdue.
text.12: all strength and valour that is found indra in tribes of nahusas and all the splendid fame that the five tribes enjoy.
text.13: bring yea all manly powers at once.
text.14: or maghavan what vigorous strength in trksi lay in druhyus or in parus folk.
text.15: fully bestow on us that in the conquering fray we may subdue our foes in fight.
text.16: o indra grant a happy home a triple refuge triply strong.
text.17: bestow a dwellingplace on the rich lords and me and keep thy dart afar from these.
text.18: they who with minds intent on spoil subdue the foe boldly attack and smite him down.
text.19: from these o indra maghavan who lovest song be closest guardian of our lives.
text.20: and now o indra strengthen us come near and aid us in the fight.
text.21: what time the feathered shafts are flying in the air the arrows with their sharpened points.
text.22: give us where heroes strain their bodies in the fight the shelter that our fathers loved.
text.23: to us and to our sons give refuge keep afar all unobserved hostility.
text.24: when indra in the mighty fray thou urgest chargers to their speed.
text.25: on the uneven road and on a toilsome path like falcons eager for renown.
text.26: speeding like rivers rushing down a steep descent responsive to the urging call.
text.27: that come like birds attracted to the bait held in by reins in both the drivers hands.
